title: 111_hr3282
content: The program provides readjustment and mental health care services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall establish a program to provide peer outreach, support, counseling, and mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as their immediate family members for readjustment to civilian life and recovery from injuries or illnesses incurred during deployment. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide education, support, counseling, and mental health services to assist veterans in readjusting to civilian life, recovering from injuries or illnesses incurred during deployment, and helping their families readjust after their return. The contracts will require the use of telehealth services and the employment of veterans trained under subsection (c). The Secretary of Veterans Affairs contracts with community health centers and entities to provide mental health services to veterans. The contracts require the use of telehealth services, employing veterans, participating in training programs, complying with VA protocols, and submitting annual reports on services provided to veterans. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs contracts with community health centers and entities to provide mental health services to veterans. The contracts require reporting on the number of veterans served, diagnosed, and treated, along with demographic information. Additionally, clinical summary information must be provided for each veteran receiving services, and training programs for peer-outreach and peer-support services are mandated. Other requirements set by the Secretary must also be met. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs mandates training programs for veterans and clinicians to provide mental health services. Veterans are trained by a national not-for-profit organization for peer-outreach and peer-support services, while clinicians are trained to recognize unique factors for veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. Reports on services provided are also required. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs mandates training programs for veterans and clinicians to provide mental health services, including recognizing unique factors for veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. Reports on the implementation of the program are required to be submitted to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. The Secretary must submit a report to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs detailing the number of veterans receiving services, evaluating service provision, and listing national mental health organizations providing services. The report must evaluate the provision of services by national mental health organizations and the training provided.
